brief_description: A prospective longitudinal study to determine biological mechanisms that underlie the immunosuppressed state associated with immunosuppressive regimens after renal transplantation.
brief_title: Impact of immunosuppressive regimens on protective immunity in renal transplant recipients
condition_studied: Assessment of vaccine response in chronically immunosuppressed renal transplant patients.
description: A prospective longitudinal study comparing renal transplant patients with controls to determine the biological mechanisms that underlie the immunosuppressed state associated with immunosuppressive regimens after transplantation.
endpoints:
1. HLA genotyping of enrolled subjects.
  2. FCM experiment to measure frequency and phenotypic profile of B and T cell subsets in chronically immunosuppressed patients.
  3. CD107A degranulation assay to assess numbers and function of antigen-specific memory T cells in chronic immunosuppression.
  4. CFSE proliferation assay to assess numbers and function of antigen-specific memory T cells in chronic immunosuppression.
  5. ELISPOT assay to assess memory B cell function in renal transplant patients with tacrolimus and sirolimus treatment.
  6. ELISA serum antibody titers to assess memory B cell function in renal transplant patients with tacrolimus and sirolimus treatment.
  7. Effects of chronic immunosuppression on dendritic cell function.
  8. Microarray experiment to define the transcriptional signatures associated with specific immunosuppressive regimens.
  9. Viral monitoring by PCR.
objectives:
1. To determine the effects of chronic immunosuppressive therapies on adaptive immunity: Effects on the phenotype and functional properties of T cell and B cell subsets and antigen-specific T cells.
  2. To determine the effects of chronic immunosuppressive therapies on innate immunity, dendritic cell phenotype, function and TLR signaling.
  3. To define the transcriptional signatures associated with specific immunosuppressive regimens.
official_title: Impact of immunosuppressive regimens on protective immunity in renal transplant recipients
